package.name: Solar
package.summary: Simple object library and application repository for PHP.
package.description:
Solar is a class library and application component suite for PHP 5 (and is PHP5 E_STRICT compliant). Solar provides simple, easy-to-comprehend classes and components for the common aspects of web-based rapid application development.
Solar is designed for developers who intend to distribute their applications to the whole world. This means, for example, the database driver functions work exactly the same way for each supported database. It also means that localization support is built in from the start.
Please visit http://solarphp.com/ for more information.
package.notes:
* General notes
* Converted all PHP4 and PEAR-like errors to PHP5 exceptions
* Unit testing now uses a strategy more like PHPUnit and SimpleTest, based on techniques developed by Greg Beaver combining .phpt tests with a simple assertion class
* Solar
* Converted to throw exceptions instead of return errors
* Added fileExists() method that checks the include_path
* Removed error() and isError() completely, replaced by exception()
* Added private __construct() to enforce singleton pattern
* Calling Solar::start(false) will cause Solar not to look for a config file at all
* Solar_App_Bookmarks
* The 'edit' action now uses exceptions for error tracking
* Solar_App_HelloWorld
* Added very simple "hello world" example to show actions/views and localization
* Solar_Base
* If you pass boolean false to the constructor, only the class default for $_config will be used (no attempt to override with Solar.config.php values), although the 'locale' key will still be automatically generated if it does not exist
* Removed all _error*() methods in favor of _exception()
* _exception() method now attempts to find appropriate exception classes: * First, one named for the class and error code * Next, one named for Solar and the error code * Then, the generic class exception * Last, the generic Solar exception
* Solar_Cache
* Added life() facade method to retrieve cache lifetime from the driver
* Added life() methods to both File and Memcache drivers
* Solar_Content
* Converted all error-based code to use exceptions instead (e.g., "return $this->_error()" is now "throw $this->_exception()")
* Solar_Controller_Front
* now properly uses _app_default when no app specified in URI (thanks Jeff Surgeson)
* now uses Solar_Uri::importAction() to import action specs as partial URIs
* added 'hello' => 'Solar_App_HelloWorld' mapping
* Solar_Controller_Page
* now properly empties the output buffer (thanks Jeff Surgeson)
* now uses Solar_Uri::importAction() to import action specs as partial URIs
* now throws Solar_Exception_FileNotReadable if an action is not found, instead of forwarding to the default action
* Solar_Exception
* Now sets $code properly at construction time
* Added customized __toString() behavior
* Added getClassCode() method to get "class::code" string
* Added "standard" exception classes in the Solar/Exception/ directory:
* ConnectionFailed * ExtensionNotLoaded * FileNotFound * FileNotReadable * MethodNotCallable * MethodNotImplemented
* Solar_Form
* Converted all error-based code to use exceptions instead (e.g., "return $this->_error()" is now "throw $this->_exception()")
* Converted Solar_Form_Load drivers to use exceptions, too
* Solar_Locale
* BC BREAK: The public $string property is now protected $_string
* BC BREAK: Removed unused public methods setString() and setStrings().
* NOTICE: renamed setCode() to reset() to indicate that strings are being reset as part of the behavior. The setCode() method is deprecated and will trigger a notice when used.
* loadClass() now uses Solar::fileExists() to check locale file existence.
* BC BREAK: Changed a number of translation keys to be in line with more-verbose exception class names.
* ERR_FILE_FIND : ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND * ERR_FILE_OPEN : removed * ERR_FILE_READ : ERR_FILE_NOT_READABLE * ERR_EXTENSION : ERR_EXTENSION_NOT_LOADED * ERR_CONNECT : ERR_CONNECTION_FAILED
* Solar_Sql
* Now loads Solar_Sql_Driver and Solar_Sql_Exception via Solar::loadClass() in the constructor
* Converted all error-based code to use exceptions instead (e.g., "return $this->_error()" is now "throw $this->_exception()")
* Added generic Solar_Sql_Exception class and a subdirectory of specific exceptions:
* ColNameLength * ColNameReserved * ColScope * ColSize * ColTypeUnknown * IdxNameLength * IdxNoColumns * IdxTypeUnknown * TableNameLength * TableNameReserved * TableNotCreated
* Solar_Sql_Driver
* Is now marked as an abstract class
* Unimplemented methods now throw Solar_Exception_MethodNotImplemented
* Converted all error-based code to use exceptions instead (e.g., "return $this->_error()" is now "throw $this->_exception()")
* Updated code in FrontBase driver left over from the "Hive" days (e.g., sequence names and exception usage)
* Solar_Sql_Select
* Converted all error-based code to use exceptions instead (e.g., "return $this->_error()" is now "throw $this->_exception()")
* Solar_Sql_Table
* Converted all error-based code to use exceptions instead (e.g., "return $this->_error()" is now "throw $this->_exception()")
* Solar_Template
* Now throws Savant3 exceptions instead of returning Solar errors
* Internal errors are now Savant errors, not Solar errors (i.e., removed error() and isError() extension methods)
* Added new plugin, actionLink(), to help with building action links
* Solar_Test
* Added new Solar_Test family of classes
* Solar_Test_Assert is a simple unit-testing assertion class for testing return values, similar to PEAR_PHPTest class from Greg Beaver
* Solar_Test_Example is specifically for use in the new unit testing suite and serves no other useful purpose
* Solar_User
* Converted all Auth and Role containers to use exceptions instead of errors
* Solar_Uri
* Added importAction() method to import action specifications as partial URIs
* Method _query2str() now urlencodes keys (in addition to the values)
* Added method clear() to clear all properties
* Added method addInfo() to add the next info value
* Solar_Valid
* blank() and notBlank() methods now convert to string before trimming (gives more accurate results)
* locale() method now honors OR_BLANK settting (was not being passed)
* maxLength() now honors OR_BLANK setting (reversed the check so that it's negative)
* mimeType() now lets you allow only certain types, and honors OR_BLANK setting
* min() now honors OR_BLANK setting
* nonZero() now honors OR_BLANK setting (reversed the check so that it's negative)
* sepWords() now honors OR_BLANK setting (was not being passed)
* uri() now allows you to pass a single allowed scheme as a string
* word() now honors OR_BLANK setting (was not being passed)

release.notes:
* WARNING: This is a public development release, and is not yet stable.
* REQUIREMENTS: You need to be running PHP 5.1RC1 (exactly) for this release to work for you; this is because of the new PDO-based SQL classes. RC3 **will not** work because they changed the constants; a followup release of Solar will address this.
* BACKWARDS COMPATIBILITY: There are major BC breaks in this release, particularly in the Solar_Sql classes, along with those classes related to and depending upon Solar_Sql.
* Removed classes:
* Solar_Sql_Entity: it has been refactored into Solar_Sql_Select, Solar_Sql_Table, and Solar_Form_Load_Table.
* Solar_Super: it pretty much did one thing, strip_tags() from GET vars. With the new escaping in Savant3, it's not really needed any more. Folded the default-value functionality into Solar.php as super().
* Solar_App_Bugs: these classes will reappear after I convert the app to the new Solar_Sql PDO-based system, and revamp the MVC structure of Solar_App.
* Solar_Cell_Bugs: probably will not reappear as a Cell because it isn't generic enough; instead, it will reappear as a model class within Solar_App_Bugs
* Added classes:
* Solar_Sql_Select to build Select statements
* Solar_Sql_Table to act as a Table Data Gateway (auto-creates tables as well)
* Solar_Form_Load_Table to auto-create forms from Solar_Sql_Table schemas
* Solar:
* Fixed bug where environment() method was not static (thanks Adrian Gheorghe)
* Solar_App_Bookmarks:
* Updated to use new Solar_Cell_Bookmarks
* You will need to migrate your old bookmarks to the new table, see migrate/0.8.0-0.9.0/convert_bookmarks.php
* You will need to change your QuickMark link to the new one (the "title" variable is now called "subj")
* Added some view candy, e.g. the tag list shows the number of times the tag appears
* Added localization for the "order by" links
* Solar_Base:
* Added errorException() method to convert exceptions to Solar_Error objects
* Now loads the locale file at __construct() time instead of on first call to locale()
* Solar_Cell_Bookmarks:
* MAJOR BC BREAK, many method names have changes
* Now based on new Solar_Content model
* Solar_Form:
* Added orderElements() method to set elements into arbitrary order
* Changed all 'validate' keys to 'valid' in all Form classes for consistency with locale and table classes
* Solar_Filter:
* Removed deprecated alphanumeric() method; use identical alnum() instead
* Solar_Sql:
* MAJOR BC BREAK: The SQL classes are now based on PDO, and there are major shifts in how the the SQL class works.
* Changed default driver class to Sqlite
* Changed default host to 127.0.0.1 (PDO doesn't like 'localhost')
* Changed exec() to query() to be more in line with PDO API
* added select() return type 'pdo' to return the PDOStatement object
* changed select() return type 'result' to return a Solar_Sql_Result object
* changed default select() return type to assign to $config['PDOStatement'] instead of $config['result']
* Added quoteInto() and quoteMulti() methods
* update() and delete() now take arrays as WHERE clauses, and pass through quoteMulti() automatically
* quote() now allows you to specify a separator string for quoted arrays converted to strings
* Solar_Sql_Driver:
* Complete BC break
* Converted to PDO usage
* Transaction support, but autocommit by default
* select-statement creation now adds tabs and newlines in column list (vice a literal \n\t)
* select-statement creation now separates FROM list by comma only (no tabs or newlines)
* fixed bug in select-statement creation JOIN implode() (wrong params)
* added transaction support methods begin(), commit(), and rollback()
* Solar_Sql_Driver_Mysql:
* Now uses InnoDB tables now (vice MyISAM) to support transactions. You'll need MySQL 4.0 or higher for this.
* Solar_Sql_Driver_Mssql:
* buildSelect() now uses smarter (but untested) LIMIT offset emulation, also takes DISTINCT into account
* Solar_Sql_Select:
* now maps columns to from/join names for deconfliction later
* from() and join() now allow you specify which columns to select
* from() and join() now allow the option to specify a table object (instead of a table name)
* fetch() automatically deconflicts columns between tables/joins when they were added via from()/join()
* updated countPages() method to take new deconfliction into account
* Solar_Sql_Result:
* complete BC break
* converted to new PDO usage
* auto-maps deconflicted colnames to arrays: looks at colnames for __ and converts to arrays on fetch()
* Solar_Sql_Table:
* automatically adds 'id' column, index, and sequence
* automatically adds 'created' column and index
* automatically adds 'updated' column and index
* insert() automatically sets 'created' and 'updated' timestamps
* update() automatically sets 'updated' timestamp
* Solar_Valid:
* Removed deprecated alphanumeric(); use identical alnum() instead
* Added mimeType() method for MIME types
* Added sepWords() method for spearated word strings
* Improved uri() method

* WARNING: This is a public development release, and is not yet stable.
* BC BREAKS: There are multiple backwards compatibility breaks in this release. In particular:
* Globally, Solar::object() becomes Solar::factory()
* Solar_App is replaced entirely by Solar_Controller_Page, with a new MVC architecture
* In Solar_Base extended classes...
* $this->config becomes $this->_config
* $this->error() becomes $this->_error()
* $this->errorPush() becomes $this->_errorPush()
* $this->errorException() becomes $this->_errorException()
* Requires PHP 5.1rc6 or later, because of PDO (in)constant names.
* Style and format changes:
* Converted tabs to 4-spaces
* Docblocks are now indented 1 extra space
* Protected properties and methods now have an underscore prefix (this is a break from PEAR coding standards)
* Order of qualifiers on properties/methods is standardized: "[final] [static] (public|protected|private)"
* Added new classes:
* Solar_Exception (not moving to exception-based errors just yet though)
* Solar_Controller_Front (front controller)
* Solar_Controller_Page (page-based application controller) ... replaces earlier Solar_App class, and is much smarter: knows its own directory, automatically renders views, tracks properties, etc.
* Solar_User_Auth_Post for simple HTTP POST request/response authentication checking
* Major BC break to MVC architecture and directory structure
* Solar_App class removed entirely
* Now applications extend Solar_Controller_Page instead
* Apps now only have controller actions and views, no models
* App models are relegated to their own namespace (e.g., Solar_Model_Bookmarks) to support mix-and-match of model classes from different applications
* Tests
* Fixed bug in tests/Base and tests/Error fr_FR translations (single quotes not escaped). Thanks, PCDinh.
* Updated tests/Error to test locale switching. * Solar
* BC break: renamed Solar::object() to Solar::factory() in line with common pattern vocabulary, changed throughout the Solar system
* Solar.php now "finds itself" in the filesystem, so you don't need to add it to the include_path. Solar::loadClass() honors this self-location via the $_dir proproperty.
* Solar_Base, _Error, and _Exception are now loaded inside the constructor, not above the class declaration
* Solar_App_Bookmarks
* Now uses the new Solar_Controller_Page class and new MVC architecture.
* You now need to add a front-contoller script in your web directory place of the previous bookmarks.php script. See the example in Solar_Controller_Front file-level comments.
* You will need to replace your QuickMark with the new one provided by Solar_App_Bookmarks.
* Solar_Cache
* Fixed bug in Solar_Cache_Memcache config (missing comma). Thanks, PCDinh.
* Solar_Sql
* Converted PDO_* constants to PDO::* namespaces.
* Solar_Sql_Driver
* The exec() method now calls PDO::exec() directly for CREATE, ALTER, and DROP commands, but uses prepared statements for everything else. This is to avoid exceptions when PDO prepares the query and doesn't support those commands.
* Solar_Sql_Driver_Sqlite
* Uses correct PDO type and DSN building routine now
* Solar_Sql_Select
* Improved starred, aliased, and parentheses checking on column names when building the statement
* Solar_Sql_Table
* Added save() method that handles "insert-or-update?" logic for you based on the presence of an "id" value in the data
* Solar_Template
* Upgraded to Savant3-3.0.0 stable
* Solar_Uri
* Fixed strpos param order bug when checking uri strings for ://
* Added "guessing" algorithm to find path_info when a uri string is imported
* Added exportAction() method to export only pathinfo, query, and fragment
* Solar_User_Auth_Sql
* Now uses Solar_Sql::select() instead of ::fetchOne (thanks Jeff Surgeson)

* General notes
* Converted all PHP4 and PEAR-like errors to PHP5 exceptions
* Unit testing now uses a strategy more like PHPUnit and SimpleTest, based on techniques developed by Greg Beaver combining .phpt tests with a simple assertion class
